ratings.comment: Professor Henson made sure to know every students name in his lecture despite there being over 100 students. It really seemed like he cared about each and every student in the class and wanted everyone to do well. This was definitely the easiest class that I have taken, due to him giving plenty of extra credit as well as being very understanding.

I really enjoyed taking Soc 134 with Professor Henson because he seemed very passionate about the subject, and he made lectures very engaging. He was also pretty chill and offered several opportunities for extra credit, which was nice. I agree that there were a lot of readings for the class, but most of the time they helped me understand content.
The professor makes the class a little too difficult for a freshman class and I would appreciate if he could've remembered what it was like to be a student .
Lectures were super engaging and very easy to follow along. I went to every lecture because he made the class fun but he does cold call.

I had professor Henson also last semester and I noticed after each negative review an overwhelmingly positive one emerges, likely because of the professor writing them. My experience in the course was similar to that of others, in the sense that it was a lot of work for a level 100 course.

I had Professor Henson for SOC 134 Fall semester and loved it! I understand the other reviews complaining about the amount of reading- but it really wasn't too bad in my opinion. He's a fantastic lecturer and made the lectures really engaging- knew everyone's name by the end of the second week. Great professor and tons of EC opportunity.

This class is good to fulfill the ethnic studies requirement, and the extra credit that is offered helps save you from failing the class so when it is announced do take note of it and you should be able to pass the class and get the requirement out of the way.

Professor Henson is an excellent instructor who takes the time to explain all the course material in detail during lectures. Although attendance isn't technically required, exams are heavily based on material that was covered specifically in lectures. He is very fair and listens to feedback and offers multiple opportunities for extra credit!!!

This class was WAY harder than it should be! Be prepared to read quite a bit if you choose to take this class. You learn about interesting things, but the material can be difficult to understand at times, and the lectures do not necessarily help that much with it.

I loved his engaging teaching style! It was both humorous and informative, although sometimes he would frame an opinion as fact. GREAT LECTURES - GO! Exams are pretty straightfoward. Watch out for the paper - spend time on that. Go to lecture, section is mandatory (not very helpful but still), study, and you should be fine.

This class is fine but I wish there was less quizzes/exams so it feels like a lot of work at the end of the day for a level 100 (i.e. freshman class). Would recommend taking one fewer class if you have this in your schedule

Compared to some of the reviews written by the instructor I would caution to people that they will likely have a lot of work to contend with should they take this class. I and others in the class have felt that the guidelines and grading criteria could be a little more fair overall

Opposite of some of the other reviews, I thought Professor Henson did a great job at lecturing. As long as you attend lectures and discussions, this is an easy A/AB class. He has even stated he does not want the class to be unnecessarily difficult as it is a 100-level class. He also does exam reviews if there are enough interested students.
This prof could have made the class a little better overall, but if you need something for the ES requirement at UW, this would be a half-decent option to consider

Henson is amazing- he's hilarious but is clear about his expectations, which are very fair. He gives tons of extra credit & tells you exactly what will be on the exams, so going to lecture is a must- which I always looked forward to going. His exams reflect the weekly quizzes and lectures exactly; honestly my studying was minimal. Highly recommend!

Morgan seems like a genuinely nice person, but overall not a good lecturer. He does not necessarily use the full lecture time, and inserts humor at weird moments about very serious topics. Also there are a few parts of the class that could be better structured overall to make things a bit clearer to students so they know what to expect

Genuinely one of my favorite classes I've taken, Henson is so knowledgable about the subject and finds such unique ways to make a large class feel personal (knows everyones names) and I'm excited to go to lecture every time. The weekly quizzes are reasonable and if you go to lecture you're set for the exams. 100% take this class if you can

Morgan is extremely funny and kind and knew every student's name by the 2nd week of the semester and genuinely cares about each of his students on an individual level. He holds himself accountable for mistakes and gives out extra credit whenever he messes up a quiz or exam question. He clearly states what you need to know for the exam.
Morgan is fine but doesn't communicate things too well in the course, and is unnecessarily difficult at times. I have not been having a good semester and he made my semester EXPONENTIALLY worse.
